result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Gerald Shilts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob Gerald Shilts is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob Gerald Shilts was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

DE appeared to inquire about reducing his monthly pymt back to $25/mo stating he was unaware that it had increased.  The DE was advised that he was mailed an updated Pymt Plan Agmt on 5-09-17 that noted his increased pymt to start 8-15-17.  DE was also advised that he should have been warranted today for non pymt & that he should contact me earlier to avoid WA/WA fees.  I advised the DE that I did not want to decrease his pymt at this time because of the bal due & interest accruing, but that he may contact me closer to 11-15-17 if he has not obtained employment or a paycheck.  DE stated he was searching for employment thru a staffing agency & may possibly start on 10-30-17.  Pymt to remain at $50 & DE to contact me if he needs to defer his pymt for 1 mo while he tries to attain a FT job.  Includes 13CF86, 14CF59, 16CM151, 16CM493. jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Jacob Gerald Shilts appeared. Case called at 1:50. Includes 15CT242,16CM151. ADA Hartung updates the court there is an agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 removing the repeater  in 16CM151. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 16CM151 removing the repeater. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM151 and 15CT242. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
1 year probation with conditions to run concurrent with current probation.
- DE to seek or maintain employment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to maintain current treatment
- DE to participate in MRT if agent believes it is appropriate. 
- DE is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, WalMart in New Richmond, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Pay restitution of $49.76
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
  Apply bond on file.  

DE to sign up for probation not later than April 9, 2016.
Filed by ADA Hartung. km
filed by Atty. B. Smestad. gme
Atty Smestad. hml
Pre-trial conference at 04-04-2016 01:45 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant to report to his Probation Agent upon release.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad,  DF:  Jacob Gerald Shilts appeared from jail via video. Defendant does qualify for PD. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  ADA Minser is requesting $200.00 CB, Atty Smestad argues. Defendant is on a PO hold. Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
